  1. from easy_thumbnails.conf import settings
  4. class Aliases(object):
  5. """
  6. A container which stores and retrieves named easy-thumbnail options
  7. dictionaries.
  8. """
  10. def __init__(self, populate_from_settings=True):
  11. """
  12. Initialize the Aliases object.
  14. :param populate_from_settings: If ``True`` (default) then populate the
  15. initial aliases from settings. See :meth:`populate_from_settings`.
  16. """
  17. self._aliases = {}
  18. if populate_from_settings:
  19. self.populate_from_settings()
  21. def populate_from_settings(self):
  22. """
  23. Populate the aliases from the ``THUMBNAIL_ALIASES`` setting.
  24. """
  25. settings_aliases = settings.THUMBNAIL_ALIASES
  26. if settings_aliases:
  27. for target, aliases in settings_aliases.items():
  28. target_aliases = self._aliases.setdefault(target, {})
  29. target_aliases.update(aliases)
  31. def set(self, alias, options, target=None):
  32. """
  33. Add an alias.
  35. :param alias: The name of the alias to add.
  36. :param options: The easy-thumbnails options dictonary for this alias
  37. (should include ``size``).
  38. :param target: A field, model, or app to limit this alias to
  39. (optional).
  40. """
  41. target = self._coerce_target(target) or ''
  42. target_aliases = self._aliases.setdefault(target, {})
  43. target_aliases[alias] = options
  45. def get(self, alias, target=None):
  46. """
  47. Get a dictionary of aliased options.
  49. :param alias: The name of the aliased options.
  50. :param target: Get alias for this specific target (optional).
  52. If no matching alias is found, returns ``None``.
  53. """
  54. for target_part in reversed(list(self._get_targets(target))):
  55. options = self._get(target_part, alias)
  56. if options:
  57. return options
  58. return self._get('', alias)
  60. def all(self, target=None, include_global=True):
  61. """
  62. Get a dictionary of all aliases and their options.
  64. :param target: Include aliases for this specific field, model or app
  65. (optional).
  66. :param include_global: Include all non target-specific aliases
  67. (default ``True``).
  69. For example::
  71. >>> aliases.all(target='my_app.MyModel')
  72. {'small': {'size': (100, 100)}, 'large': {'size': (400, 400)}}
  73. """
  74. aliases = {}
  75. for target_part in self._get_targets(target, include_global):
  76. aliases.update(self._aliases.get(target_part, {}))
  77. return aliases
  79. def _get(self, target, alias):
  80. """
  81. Internal method to get a specific alias.
  82. """
  83. if target not in self._aliases:
  84. return
  85. return self._aliases[target].get(alias)
  87. def _get_targets(self, target, include_global=True):
  88. """
  89. Internal iterator to split up a complete target into the possible parts
  90. it may match.
  92. For example::
  94. >>> list(aliases._get_targets('my_app.MyModel.somefield'))
  95. ['', 'my_app', 'my_app.MyModel', 'my_app.MyModel.somefield']
  96. """
  97. target = self._coerce_target(target)
  98. if include_global:
  99. yield ''
  100. if not target:
  101. return
  102. target_bits = target.split('.')
  103. for i in range(len(target_bits)):
  104. yield '.'.join(target_bits[:i + 1])
  106. def _coerce_target(self, target):
  107. """
  108. Internal method to coerce a target to a string.
  110. The assumption is that if it is not ``None`` and not a string, it is
  111. a Django ``FieldFile`` object.
  112. """
  113. if not target or isinstance(target, basestring):
  114. return target
  115. model = target.instance.__class__
  116. return '%s.%s.%s' % (
  117. model._meta.app_label,
  118. model.__name__,
  119. target.field.name,
  120. )
  123. aliases = Aliases()
